definitions.definition: The condition of being impure ; because of contamination , pollution , adulteration or insufficient purification .
examples: Even animals in the Jewish system cause impurity only when they are dead.

definitions.definition: A component or additive that renders something else impure.
examples: The impurities in the iron ore made extraction of the iron very difficult.

definitions.definition: A state of immorality or sin ; especially the weakness of the flesh: inchastity .
examples: With his cheating, lying and stealing, he epitomised the impurity of humanity.

main_definition: The condition of being impure ; because of contamination , pollution , adulteration or insufficient purification .
secondary_definitions: A component or additive that renders something else impure.
A state of immorality or sin ; especially the weakness of the flesh: inchastity .
